instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message: i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery. and no green light on the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
Does it charge until 44% and then stuck?
Magsafe light must be orange to charge battery.
If you don't get green at least, never will charge.
Any history available?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery connected; also with charger + battery.
Need <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 voltages too.
Check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to central pin of Magsafe connector in DCIN board.
Did you try known good DCIN board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
no it not charge at all
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.5V with and without battery (why to test with and without battery ) 
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 2.5 to 2.9v
yes I already tried a new DCIN
no history

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 3.3v"
Each one has 5 pins; however, I'm not interested in ground pin voltage.
And voltage of pins 4/5 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> is very important to know.

"why to test with and without battery"
Depending of battery state, should get different voltage!

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Percentage indication points to good communication, but is better to confirm.

If all is OK, seems to have a problem with SMC.
In such case, reflow it first; may need to reball, or change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message: Sounds like bad battery, but this will have a dead GPU soon so who cares tbh

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/
05 2.9V
04 2.9V
01 3.5V
SCL/SDA 0.503 dido mode

but I don't have a green light on MagSafe even without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
Do what I told on SMC.

GPU can be disabled, when finally dies...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
GPU was replaced in China
suddenly it worked, but stopped after I replaced DCIN again it worked for a while it stopped again.
I just reballed SMC same ...
i dont have SMC now but i will order one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message:
"it stopped again"
Still no light on magsafe?
If board reacts after applying heat, could also be PCH problem.
Resolder <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, turn on but stuck on 44% battery
threads.message: DCIN  was the problem, I tested with a dead one thank you
